PERSONA:
Ryan Thompson is a 37-year-old White male living in Cheyenne, Wyoming. He resides with his parents in a single-family home in a suburban neighborhood. Despite being married, Ryan is currently living apart from his spouse due to work-related reasons; his wife works as a nurse in a nearby town and they are maintaining a commuter relationship. Ryan graduated from high school in Cheyenne and did not pursue higher education due to financial constraints. He is fluent in English, having been born and raised in the United States.

Ryan works as a full-time mechanic at a local automotive repair shop, earning approximately $52,000 annually. His job provides stable income and benefits, allowing him to contribute to his family's household expenses. As he lives with his parents, Ryan does not have to worry about rent or mortgage payments, which enables him to save money for his future goals.

Ryan's economic concerns are centered around job security and the rising cost of living in Wyoming. As someone working in a skilled trade, he is aware of the importance of vocational training and apprenticeships. He also worries about the impact of economic downturns on his industry and the potential for job losses. Ryan's priorities include saving for a down payment on a house, planning for his eventual move to live with his wife full-time, and starting a family.
